description.value: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d4 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 5/15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: The target is &Reference[restrained]{restrained}. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 &Reference[str]{Strength} check to free itself or another creature in a net, ending the effect on a success. Dealing [[/damage 5 slashing average=false]] damage to the net (AC 10) frees the target without harming it and destroys the net.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Amphibious. The kuo-toa can breathe air and water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Otherworldly &Reference[prc]{Perception}. The kuo-toa can sense the presence of any creature within 30 feet of it that is &Reference[invisible]{invisible} or on the Ethereal Plane. It can pinpoint such a creature that is moving.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Slippery. The kuo-toa has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, the kuo-toa has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

When a creature misses the kuo-toa with a melee weapon attack, the kuo-toa uses its sticky shield to catch the weapon. The attacker must succeed on a [[/save str 11 format=long]], or the weapon becomes stuck to the kuo-toaâ€™s shield. If the weaponâ€™s wielder canâ€™t or wonâ€™t let go of the weapon, the wielder is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} while the weapon is stuck. While stuck, the weapon canâ€™t be used. A creature can pull the weapon free by taking an action to make a DC 11 &Reference[str]{Strength} check and succeeding.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.
